meanings.definition: To surpass in brilliance or splendor.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display will outdazzle all the other attractions at the fair.
meanings.sent2: Her smile seemed to outdazzle the sun on a clear summer day.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's glittery dress managed to outdazzle the twinkling stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The grand chandelier in the ballroom could never outdazzle the sparkle in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The radiant sunset tried to outdazzle the majestic sunrise.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in a dazzling manner.
meanings.sent1: The new LED lights will outdazzle the old incandescent bulbs in brightness.
meanings.sent2: Her performance on stage managed to outdazzle all the other contestants.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to outdazzle the audience with his flashy costume.
meanings.sent4: The diamond necklace could never outdazzle her natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display tried to outdazzle the city skyline with its colorful explosions.
